examples: This towel's dry . Could you wet it and cover the chicken so it doesn't go dry as it cooks?

definitions.definition: Unable to produce a liquid , as water , ( petrochemistry ) oil , or ( agriculture ) milk .
examples: This well is as dry as that cow.

definitions.definition: Anhydrous : free from or lacking water in any state , regardless of the presence of other liquids .
Free from or lacking alcohol or alcoholic beverages .
examples: Of course it's a dry house. He was an alcoholic but he's been dry for almost a year now.

definitions.definition: Describing an area where sales of alcoholic or strong alcoholic beverages are banned .
examples: You'll have to drive out of this dry county to find any liquor.

definitions.definition: Free from or lacking embellishment or sweetness , particularly :

subdefinitions.definition: Low in sugar ; lacking sugar ; unsweetened .
examples: Proper martinis are made with London dry gin and dry vermouth.
subdefinitions.label_groups: wine and other alcoholic beverages , ginger ale

examples: Steven Wright has a deadpan delivery, Norm Macdonald has a dry sense of humor, and Oscar Wilde had a dry wit.
A dry lecture may require the professor to bring a water gun in order to keep the students' attention.

subdefinitions.definition: Of a board or flop : Not permitting the creation of many  or of strong hands .
examples: Jake was hoping to make something good out of his suited 7-8 hand, but the flop came out dry : 2-5-10 rainbow , and all of the wrong suit!.

subdefinitions.definition: Exhibiting precise execution lacking delicate contours or soft transitions of color .

definitions.definition: Not using afterburners or water injection for increased thrust.
examples: This fighter jet's engine has a maximum dry thrust of 200 kilonewtons.

definitions.definition: Involving computations rather than work with biological or chemical matter .
Free from applied audio effects (especially reverb).
Without a usual complement or consummation ; impotent .
examples: dry snitches are as bad as regular snitches

subdefinitions.definition: Of a bite from an animal : not containing the usual venom .

definitions.definition: Of a mass, service, or rite: involving neither consecration nor communion .
Mixed with sauce and not served in a soup .

secondary_definitions: Unable to produce a liquid , as water , ( petrochemistry ) oil , or ( agriculture ) milk .
( masonry ) Built without or lacking mortar .
( chemistry ) Anhydrous : free from or lacking water in any state , regardless of the presence of other liquids .
Free from or lacking alcohol or alcoholic beverages .
( law ) Describing an area where sales of alcoholic or strong alcoholic beverages are banned .
Free from or lacking embellishment or sweetness , particularly :
( aviation ) Not using afterburners or water injection for increased thrust.
( sciences , somewhat derogatory ) Involving computations rather than work with biological or chemical matter .
( of a sound recording ) Free from applied audio effects (especially reverb).
Without a usual complement or consummation ; impotent .
( Christianity ) Of a mass, service, or rite: involving neither consecration nor communion .
( Malaysia , Singapore , of noodles ) Mixed with sauce and not served in a soup .
